ScaledNearestTraceReducer#

class ScaledNearestTraceReducer(step_time: float, time_constant: float, amplitude: int | float | complex, scale: int | float | complex, criterion: OneToOne[Tensor], *, history_len: float = 0.0)[source]#

Bases: FoldingReducer

Stores the trace over time, scaled by the input, considering the latest match.

\[\begin{split}x_{t + \Delta t} = \begin{cases} a + Sf &K(f_{t + \Delta t}) \\ x_t \exp (\Delta t / \tau) &\text{otherwise} \end{cases}\end{split}\]

For the trace (state) \(x\) and observation \(f\).

Parameters:

  • step_time (float) – length of the discrete step time, \(\Delta t\).

  • time_constant (float) – time constant of exponential decay, \(\tau\).

  • amplitude (int | float | complex) – value to set trace to for matching elements, \(a\).

  • scale (int | float | complex) – multiplicitive scale for contributions to trace, \(S\).

  • criterion (OneToOne[torch.Tensor]) – function to test if the input is considered a match for the purpose of tracing, \(K\).

  • history_len (float, optional) – length of time over which results should be stored, in the same units as \(\Delta t\). Defaults to 0.0.

Note

The output of criterion must have a datatype (torch.dtype) of torch.bool.

Note

Only a single input tensor can be provided to forward() for this class.

property dt: float#

Length of the simulation time step, in milliseconds.

Parameters:

value (float) – new simulation time step length.

Returns:

length of the simulation time step.

Return type:

float

fold(obs: Tensor, state: Tensor | None) → Tensor[source]#

Application of scaled nearest trace.

Parameters:

  • obs (torch.Tensor) – observation to incorporate into state.

  • state (torch.Tensor | None) – state from the prior time step, None if no prior observations.

Returns:

state for the current time step.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

initialize(inputs: Tensor) → Tensor[source]#

Setting of entire state history to zero.

Parameters:

inputs (torch.Tensor) – empty tensor of state.

Returns:

filled state tensor.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

interpolate(prev_data: Tensor, next_data: Tensor, sample_at: Tensor, step_time: float) → Tensor[source]#

Exponential decay interpolation between observations.

Parameters:

  • prev_data (torch.Tensor) – most recent observation prior to sample time.

  • next_data (torch.Tensor) – most recent observation subsequent to sample time.

  • sample_at (torch.Tensor) – relative time at which to sample data.

  • step_data (float) – length of time between the prior and subsequent observations.

Returns:

interpolated data at sample time.

Return type:

torch.Tensor
